intro: [WRONG START] Aesculus hippocastum var. beaumanii, commonly known as the Beaumanii horse chestnut, is a cultivar of the horse chestnut tree native to Europe. It is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that bloom in early summer, followed by ornamental red bracts. The leaves are palmately compound, with five to seven leaflets that are glossy and dark green. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens and parks. It is relatively disease-resistant and thrives in well-drained soil and full sun.
